title: It's not Real
review:
My review is about how, unfortunately, the product does not work.
I know it's a disappointment.
I will say it DOES work in the sense it gets you to try and practice focusing, which I guess IS the objective, even if the matter in which they're doing it is false.

So with the Mendi headset the way to manipulate you score is scrunch your brow (like when mad) OR looking up vs down at any given time (you don't need to shake your head).
Whenever you look up your score will be low... whenever you look down your score will be sky high.

I think what this device measures IS blood flow to your brain (frontal cortex), BUT how much you lean forward is how much "blood" is there.

Picturing being hung upside down.. you can really feel where the blood is going to your head (and probably Mendi would tell you you're brain capacity is beyond 100%).

Lastly, your score for how you're improving factors heavily into how OFTEN you use it (your streak and what day you are on). So, are you REALLY getting better just because you're using it more often?
I'd argue someone with a great score, using a new account, would have a bad score because the game is just rewarding you being disciplined and showing up.

I am sorry to be the one to let you down.
I wish I could post a picture showing you my findings but Trust Pilot does not offer this feature.

Some positives is the music is good, visuals are good, concept it GREAT.

...But it's all fake.

The good stuff:
Mendi is a nicely design product, and the whole ecommerce experienced worked very well. The app in itself is pretty nice, and the "game" is very well designed which makes it kind of fun to play.

My doubts:
I was quite invested in trying out the product but I couldn't help but wondering if it actually has any effect. It says in the app that you should experience some effect after 6-8 weeks. I used the product 3-5 times per week for 11 consecutive weeks but I can't say that I experienced any effect. It does measure something, that much I can say, but I'm not sure that the "exercise" actually has any effect. I did become better at the game in the first weeks, but then it pretty quickly levelled out, and I didn't experience any other effect. If the device didn't break down (more in next paragraph) I would probably keep using it for a while longer to see if there would be any effect, but at this point in time I would not recommend it to a friend.

The bad stuff:
It loses connection quite a lot which is a bit annoying. It seemed to get worse over time.
What's worse, after 11 weeks, it stopped charging and is now completely dead. It has amazing battery time, so it was actually only the third or fourth time I charged it. I find this disappointing in terms of quality.

So all in all, a nice device that probably doesn't do anything, and even if it does, its quality is fair below par. Don't buy it! Instead, use the 10 minutes per day to meditate for free - you will have a much better effect.

I have had the product right at a year, initially a few times a week and lately nearly every day (skip on Sundays a lot!). Initially I noticed improved creativity early on and that my mind was quieter - less cluttered. I later noticed after continued use I had vastly improved metacognition (thoughts about thoughts, essentially realizing what I am thinking at any given moment). This led to a recent breakthrough and subsequent newfound insight into long-term issues with anxiety that was leading to emotional thinking and reactivity as opposed to rational response in any given situation, especially one that was novel or anxiety provoking. I can now take any internal emotional "temperature" at any given moment (and remembering to do so!) and retain a state of calm with profoundly greater consistency.

Also for the first time I have been able to read rapidly without internal pronunciation of words. This was just discovered since I had fallen out of the habit of reading novels until just starting a course through work.

I have deep gratitude for what Mendi has done for me and how it has improved my quality of life.

title: A great device that truly improves your mind
review:
Biofeedback such as Mendi have evolved much thanks to better sensors. Unfortunately what programmers often forget is the user friendly aspect of a device. I have used other devices before Mendi and their worst feature was that the developer is often more concerned about collecting data for his company than provide the user with a friendly app. How can one concentrate or meditate if we are frustrated by that device? For a user like myself this is why I am now exclusively using Mendi and looking forward to my daily session. By user friendly I mean firstly the ease to connect, and more important, the ability to restart if we are not comfortable during calibration. Secondly if you decide to redo a session, the Mendi app will keep the best session. Last but not least the ease to contact a real person for support is very important. Users may take these features for granted but that it is not the case. These are the features that allow me to be relaxed when starting a gainful daily session with Mendi. I will recommend Mendi over any similar devices.
May I also suggest a fancy box for Mendi users?
A warm thank you to all the staff for a true masterpiece.
